results.title: The Fisherman's boy
results.brief_description: Explains some of the operations of a commercial fishing boat on a large lake. Tells how the captain’s small son learns to fish with a bobber from the dock before he is allowed to accompany his father on the boat.
results.description: Explains some of the operations of a commercial fishing boat on a large lake. Tells how the captain’s small son learns to fish with a bobber from the dock before he is allowed to accompany his father on the boat.

results.title: The Fisherman
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Don Murray and Stanley Dalby
results.brief_description: Centred on the southern New South Wales coastal town of Eden, this film looks at the background of one of Australia’s basic primary industries - tuna fishing. The film examines the daily routine of one of the typical fishing families in the town.

results.title: The Fisher king
results.creator_credit: Tri-Star Pictures, Debra Hill, Lynda Obst and Terry Gilliam
results.brief_description: When a bigshot self-absorbed talkback radio host, Jack Lucas (Jeff Bridges), loses his job after a tragedy, he is plucked from disaster by the most improbable of saviours - a former history professor (Robin Williams), driven mad and onto the streets where he lives in a remarkable medieval world full of swords and sorcery, terrifying Red Knights and damsels in distress. This film serves grand lunacy and wisdom of the highest order with rare vision and style.

results.title: The Fish that nearly drowned
results.creator_credit: Moscow Educational Films and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: A voice-over of aquarium scenes describing an Asian fish that can breathe air. Tells the story of various incidents that take place in the aquarium including the life habits of the fish showing how it builds its nest, and how an accident nearly causes its death.

results.title: The Fish run
results.creator_credit: Merlin Films, Jack Flack and Jack Howells
results.brief_description: The daily 300-mile run of heavy transport lorries carrying fish from Aberdeen to Manchester, filmed against an interesting scenic background. On the occasion recorded in the film, the run takes on an added interest as the lorries are testing a new fuel injector pump en route.

results.title: The Fish from Japan
results.brief_description: A young boy, believing he is being sent a live fish from Japan by his uncle is disappointed when the ‘fish’ turns out to be a fish painted on a kite. Having already told his classmates that a fish from Japan is on its way he invents an imaginary fish that captures the imagination of all, teacher included. A contemporary variation on the theme of the “Emperor’s New Clothes”.

results.title: The First World Karate-Do Championship tournament
results.brief_description: Footage of the “First world karate-do Championships Tournament”, including opening ceremony and demonstrations. Presumably held in Japan, c. 1960. Competing countries include: Thailand, Indonesia, States of Brunei, USA, Great Britain, Korea, Canada, Chile, Hon Kong, Israel, Malaysia, Mexico, New Zealand, and many others. 1st, 2nd and 3rd places won by Japan.

results.title: The First signs of Washoe
results.brief_description: This film focuses on Washoe, a chimpanzee who from the age of ten months was taught to express herself using American sign language. Also looks at another chimp, Lana, who can construct sentences in correct order to achieve simple computer commands. This film also raises questions concerning the nature/nurture issue.

results.title: The First priority
results.creator_credit: United Nations Television, National Educational Television, Joe O'Brien and Ray Davey
results.brief_description: A comprehensive summary of the world food problem indicating why it is such a crucial problem today. Shows how the FAO is already coping with the problem and how the campaign is aimed at showing people all over the world what can be done. Gives examples of action projects aimed at long term solutions.

results.title: The First pollution
results.brief_description: Reports on current efforts to clean up soources of water supply in America and potential solutions to the problem of water pollution. Comparative footage of two major rivers shows the results of an expanding program of waste treatment. Illustrates industry’s role in controlling and reducing pollution hazards. Visits the waste treatment plant at Lake Tahoe.
